text: San Ignacio (the Spanish language name of St. Ignatius) is a common toponym in parts of the world where that language is or was spoken : == North and Central America == === Belize === * San Ignacio, Belize (Cayo District), towns in western Belize === Costa Rica === * San Ignacio de Costa, Acosta, San José Province === El Salvador === * San Ignacio, Chalatenango === Honduras === * San Ignacio, Francisco Morazán === Mexico === * San Ignacio, Baja California Sur * San Ignacio, Chihuahua (Práxedis G. Guerrero) * San Ignacio, Sinaloa * San Ignacio Río Muerto (Sonora) * San Ignacio Lagoon * San Ignacio Cerro Gordo, Jalisco === United States === * San Ignacio, Texas == Oceania == * former colonial name of Pagan, Northern Marianas == South America == === Argentina === * San Ignacio District (Misiones Province) * San Ignacio Miní, Jesuit mission in Misiones Province === Bolivia === * San Ignacio de Moxos * San Ignacio de Velasco * San Ignacio, Mamoré === Chile === * San Ignacio, Chile, a town in the Ñuble Region, Chile === Paraguay === * San Ignacio, Misiones, a city and district in the Misiones Department of Paraguay === Peru === * San Ignacio, Perú * San Ignacio District, Peru * San Ignacio Province, Cajamarca Region of Peru, capital of this province is the city of San Ignacio == Spain == * San Ignacio (Ponga)
title: San Ignacio
